title: Feedly
descriptionMarkdown: This connector allows you to ingest IoCs from Feedly.

sampleQueries.query:
feedly_indicators_CL
 | where type_s == "ip"
 | sort by TimeGenerated desc

dataTypes.name: feedly_indicators_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
feedly_indicators_CL
 | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
 | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
feedly_indicators_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

customs.name: Data Collection Endpoint and Rule
customs.description: A Data Collection Endpoint (DCE) and Data Collection Rule (DCR) must be created before deploying this connector. [See the documentation to learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/custom-logs-migrate).

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Functions and the Logs Ingestion API to pull IoCs from Feedly into Microsoft Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Functions pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/) for details.

instructionSteps.title: Step 1 - Create Data Collection Endpoint and Rule
instructionSteps.description:
Before deploying the connector, you must create:

1. **Data Collection Endpoint (DCE)**: Navigate to Azure Monitor > Data Collection Endpoints and create a new endpoint in the same region as your Log Analytics workspace.

2. **Custom Table**: In your Log Analytics workspace, create a custom table named `feedly_indicators_CL` with the following columns:
   - `type_s` (string)
   - `value_s` (string)
   - `articleTitle_s` (string)
   - `articleUrl_s` (string)
   - `source_s` (string)
   - `TimeGenerated` (datetime)

3. **Data Collection Rule (DCR)**: Create a DCR that:
   - Uses the DCE created above as the endpoint
   - Defines a stream named `DCR_feedly_indicators_CL`
   - Targets the `feedly_indicators_CL` table in your Log Analytics workspace
   - Has a simple transformation query like: `source | project TimeGenerated, type_s, value_s, articleTitle_s, articleUrl_s, source_s`

For detailed instructions, see: [Migrate from HTTP Data Collector API to Logs Ingestion API](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/custom-logs-migrate)

instructionSteps.title: Step 2 - Create Azure AD App Registration
instructionSteps.description:
1. In Azure Portal, navigate to Azure Active Directory > App registrations > New registration
2. Create a new application and note the **Application (client) ID** and **Directory (tenant) ID**
3. Create a client secret under Certificates & secrets and note the **secret value**
4. Navigate to your Data Collection Rule, select Access control (IAM), and assign the **Monitoring Metrics Publisher** role to the application you just created

instructionSteps.title: Step 3 - Get your Feedly API token
instructionSteps.description: Go to https://feedly.com/i/team/api and generate a new API token for the connector.

instructionSteps.title: (Optional Step) Securely store credentials in Azure Key Vault
instructionSteps.description: Azure Key Vault provides a secure mechanism to store and retrieve secrets. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) to use Azure Key Vault with an Azure Function App by using the `@Microsoft.KeyVault(SecretUri={Security Identifier})` schema.

instructionSteps.title: Step 4 - Deploy the connector
instructionSteps.description:
Choose ONE from the following two deployment options to deploy the connector and the associated Azure Function

>**IMPORTANT:** Before deploying, gather the following information:
- Data Collection Endpoint URL
- Data Collection Rule Immutable ID
- Azure AD Tenant ID, Client ID, and Client Secret
- Feedly API Token and Stream IDs

innerSteps.title: Option 1 - Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template
innerSteps.description:
Use this method for automated deployment of the Feedly connector.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://aka.ms/sentinel-Feedly-azuredeploy)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Location**. 
3. Enter the required parameters:
   - **DataCollectionEndpoint**: Your DCE URL (e.g., `https://my-dce.eastus-1.ingest.monitor.azure.com`)
   - **DcrImmutableId**: The immutable ID from your DCR properties
   - **DcrStreamName**: `DCR_feedly_indicators_CL` (default)
   - **AzureTenantId**: Your Azure AD tenant ID
   - **AzureClientId**: Application (client) ID from Step 2
   - **AzureClientSecret**: Client secret value from Step 2
   - **FeedlyApiKey**: Your Feedly API token from Step 3
   - **FeedlyStreamIds**: Comma-separated list of Feedly stream IDs
   - **DaysToBackfill**: Number of days to backfill (default: 7)

>**Note**: If using Azure Key Vault secrets, use the `@Microsoft.KeyVault(SecretUri={Security Identifier})` schema in place of the string values. Refer to [Key Vault references documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) for further details. 
4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above**. 
5. Click **Purchase** to deploy.

innerSteps.title: Option 2 - Manual Deployment of Azure Functions
innerSteps.description: Use the following step-by-step instructions to deploy the Feedly connector manually with Azure Functions (Deployment via Visual Studio Code).

innerSteps.title: 1. Deploy a Function App
innerSteps.description:
**NOTE:** You will need to [prepare VS code](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/functions-create-first-function-python#prerequisites) for Azure function development.

1. Download the [Azure Function App](https://aka.ms/sentinel-Feedly-functionapp) file. Extract archive to your local development computer.
2. Start VS Code. Choose File in the main menu and select Open Folder.
3. Select the top level folder from extracted files.
4. Choose the Azure icon in the Activity bar, then in the **Azure: Functions** area, choose the **Deploy to function app** button.
If you aren't already signed in, choose the Azure icon in the Activity bar, then in the **Azure: Functions** area, choose **Sign in to Azure**
If you're already signed in, go to the next step.
5. Provide the following information at the prompts:

	a. **Select folder:** Choose a folder from your workspace or browse to one that contains your function app.

	b. **Select Subscription:** Choose the subscription to use.

	c. Select **Create new Function App in Azure** (Don't choose the Advanced option)

	d. **Enter a globally unique name for the function app:** Type a name that is valid in a URL path. The name you type is validated to make sure that it's unique in Azure Functions. (e.g. FeedlyXXXX).

	e. **Select a runtime:** Choose Python 3.10.

	f. Select a location for new resources. For better performance and lower costs choose the same [region](https://azure.microsoft.com/regions/) where Microsoft Sentinel is located.

6. Deployment will begin. A notification is displayed after your function app is created and the deployment package is applied.
7. Go to Azure Portal for the Function App configuration.

innerSteps.title: 2. Configure the Function App
innerSteps.description:
1. In the Function App, select the Function App Name and select **Configuration**.
2. In the **Application settings** tab, select **New application setting**.
3. Add each of the following application settings individually, with their respective values (case-sensitive):
		- `DataCollectionEndpoint`: Your DCE URL
		- `DcrImmutableId`: Your DCR immutable ID
		- `DcrStreamName`: `DCR_feedly_indicators_CL`
		- `AzureTenantId`: Your Azure AD tenant ID
		- `AzureClientId`: Your application client ID
		- `AzureClientSecret`: Your application client secret
		- `FeedlyApiKey`: Your Feedly API token
		- `FeedlyStreamIds`: Comma-separated Feedly stream IDs
		- `DaysToBackfill`: Number of days to backfill (e.g., 7)

>**Note**: Use Azure Key Vault references for sensitive values: `@Microsoft.KeyVault(SecretUri={Security Identifier})`

4. Once all application settings have been entered, click **Save**.
